thread.title_full: Clark Montessori captain will play Friday

title: Clark Montessori captain will play Friday
text:
Clark Montessori captain will play Friday 
Updated: Thu, Oct 15 2015, 12:04 AM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- A high school football player will be suiting up Friday, Oct. 16, after a court battle to get back on the field. Damion Blythe is a senior captain for Clark Montessori but he hasn't played in one game this year. He has learning disabilities which affected an English project last year. He was given an incomplete but got extra time over the summer and earned a "C." But the incomplete -- not the "c" -- went through to the Ohio Athletic Association which deemed him ineligible. Clark Montessori went to bat for him to no avail. A hearing Tuesday, Oct. 13, was suddenly canceled and Blythe will be able to play Friday against Summit Country Day for the first time this year.
